intro: Begonia gracillima, commonly known as the slender begonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, trailing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for hanging baskets and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
